result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex L Hajdasz

records.addlTxt:
2:33 PM Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz.  Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Matters 22CF106 and 22CF110 heard at the same time.     Both cases are set for PH.     Court informed DE of his right to appear in person.  DE understands his rights and waived personal appearance.  DE understands his right to a PH.  DE waived the PH in both cases.  Court accepted waiver of PH.   Parties have reached an agreement in this matter.     Court reviewed the Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form on file.  Court informed DE of his Constitutional Rights.  DE understands his rights.  
22CF106: DE plead NC to Ct 2, Misd. Theft as a Repeater and NC to Ct. 3 Misd. CDTP as a Repeater.  Court finds DE guilty of both counts. Remaining count dismissed but R/I for sentencing.
22CF110:  DE plead NC to Ct 1 Felony Poss of Meth as a Repeater and NC to Ct 2 Felony Bail Jumping as a Repeater.  Court finds DE guilty of both counts.   Remaining counts dismissed but R/I for sentencing.  
Court ordered PSI with a completion date by 1/13/23 but if Department can complete PSI earlier Court is willing to schedule sentencing date sooner.
DE asked the court if the no contact with his parents is dropped. DA stated victim witness will check into this further.   
Sentencing scheduled for 2/16/23 at 11:00 AM for one hour.   Adj. 2:59 PM
Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on February 16, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:29 AM Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 22CF110, 22CF106. Cases will need to be rescheduled.
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Received an email from Chippewa Jail stating defendant refused to sign bond.
Emailed signature bond to Chippewa Co Jail for Alex to sign. SHjailers@Co.Chippewa.wi.us
No physical contact with LRH and WMH, DE may have phone contact with them.

1:21 PM Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video from Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Waive formal reading of the CC. State asking for a $2500.00 sign bond,  no contact with LRH, WMH or their residence. DE addresses the court, states he speaks with his parents daily, states they wish to have contact and have the charges dropped.  State has no objection to phone contact with LRH and WMH.  

The court will order a $2500.00 sign bond, no physical contact with LRH and WMH, DE may have phone contact with them.  Adj 1:26pm
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Fax/Fax confirmation of bonds to Chippewa Jail. (call back from the Jail that DE refused to sign the bonds)
SIGNATURE BONDS CAME BACK AS REFUSED TO SIGN BY DE.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. Bond concurrent with 22CF110.

8:34 AM Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video from Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 22CF106, 22CF110.  Hearing to address bond modification.  Per Atty Gill DE was recently sentenced in Chippewa County so DE would like to be able to have a sign bond and exercise Huber privilege while in Chippewa.  The State has had the opportunity to speak with the victim in this case, State does not object to a sign bond at this time. 

Court will modify bond to a $1000.00 sign bond, Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.
Initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:06 AM Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video from Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 22CF106 and 22CF110. 

Competency Hearing-Report has been reviewed by parties. No objection to the Report. Court will find DE is competent to stand trial.  

Bond modification-Atty Gill enters argument as to bond, asks the court for  a sign bond, DE has recently plead in Chippewa County and is serving that sentence.  The State argues for the cash bond to remain, DE has many open cases in Barron, Washburn, Rusk County.  DE states he can reside with his parents if released.  State has no information as to this.  The court will set a Bond Hearing August 5, 2022 @ 8:30AM. Adj 11:24am.
Order for competency Examination
